function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Spread of contagious diseases through the built environment microbiome","Impact":"Risk of increased illness and disease transmission in indoor spaces","Mitigation":"Regular cleaning and disinfection of indoor spaces, improving ventilation and air quality, and promoting personal hygiene practices","Technologies":"Air purification systems, UV disinfection, germicidal light fixtures, antimicrobial surfaces","People":"Occupants of indoor spaces, especially those in close proximity to each other","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, and public health authorities"},{"Description":"Lack of understanding of the link between design and the microbiology of the indoor environment","Impact":"Limited ability to influence human health through built environment design","Mitigation":"Increased research and collaboration between biologists, designers, and public health experts","Technologies":"Microbiome analysis tools, environmental monitoring devices, collaboration platforms","People":"Biologists, designers, public health experts","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies, private companies"},{"Description":"Limited research focused on biological processes shaping indoor ecosystems and their impact on human health","Impact":"Lack of knowledge about the factors influencing indoor ecosystem health and its effect on human well-being","Mitigation":"Increase research funding for studying the link between indoor ecosystems and human health, interdisciplinary collaboration between biologists, architects, and public health professionals","Technologies":"Biological data analytics, environmental sensors, bioinformatics tools","People":"Researchers, architects, public health professionals","Owner":"Funding agencies, research institutions, and academic organizations"}]}
